means: (产于美国大西洋沿岸的)金鳍锯鳃石鲈(Lagodon rhomboides)

sentence.Network_en: The sailor's wife had a foreboding that he would not return.
sentence.Network_cn: 那海员的妻子预感到他将一去不复返.

sentence.Network_en: The old sailor's stories of his adventures charmed the boys.
sentence.Network_cn: 老水手自己的冒险故事使男孩子们着了迷?

sentence.Network_en: Heave ho ! ( sailor's cries when pulling at ropes or cables )
sentence.Network_cn: 用力拉呀! ( 水手拉绳或缆时的呼声 )

means.word_mean: 1. similar to sea bream; small spiny-finned fish found in bays along the southeastern coast of the United States
2. found from Florida to Brazil and Gulf of Mexico

auth_sentence.content: Father's war His father Peter was a sailor during World War II.

auth_sentence.content: But a third world title in Perth this December would reignite the Lowestoft sailor's challenge.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: But a third world title in Perth this December would reignite the Lowestoft sailor's challenge.

auth_sentence.content: The sailor's rescue has been described as a "very big if" by the captain of the vessel tasked to save him.
